results.title: Target for tonight
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of a bombing raid by Britain’s Royal Air Force on a German base in 1941. Covers the preliminary planning beginning with aerial photographic reconnaissance of the objective, preparations and the attack itself.
results.description: A dramatic reconstruction of a bombing raid by Britain’s Royal Air Force on a German base in 1941. Covers the preliminary planning beginning with aerial photographic reconnaissance of the objective, preparations and the attack itself.

results.title: Taming the Sutlej
results.creator_credit: Ravi Prakash, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: The Bhakra-Nangal Project designed to provide a year-round supply of water for irrigation and hydro-electric power for homes and industry, consists of two dams across the Sutlej, one at Bhakra, the other at Nangal. This film records the work done by men and machines in an effort to complete the job before the specified date.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ravi Prakash, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.description: The Bhakra-Nangal Project designed to provide a year-round supply of water for irrigation and hydro-electric power for homes and industry, consists of two dams across the Sutlej, one at Bhakra, the other at Nangal. results.title: Taming the Red Swamp
results.brief_description: A swamp was formed when sand shaped a land bridge between Wilson’s Promontory and the mainland. Shows the draining and cultivating of the Red Swamp, the addition of chemicals to the original peat, and the sowing of a seed mixture of several grasses and clovers. Dairy cattle now feed here on some of the best red clover in the State.

results.title: Taming the crippler
results.creator_credit: Jay Bonafield and RKO Pathe Pictures
results.brief_description: Shows the progress since 1916 of the battle to defeat poliomyelitis. Earlier devices and treatments with respirators, physical therapy, hydro-therapy, hot-packs are depicted. Concludes with the introduction of the salk vaccine.
results.description: Shows the progress since 1916 of the battle to defeat poliomyelitis. Earlier devices and treatments with respirators, physical therapy, hydro-therapy, hot-packs are depicted. Concludes with the introduction of the salk vaccine.

results.title: Taj Mahal
results.creator_credit: Mushir Ahmad, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A study of the Taj Mahal in Agra. An impression of the interior and exterior of the old mausoleum, and the surrounding gardens; story of Shar Jahan and the erection of Taj Mahal to the memory of his wife; the blending of Saracenic and Hindu styles in the architecture; the inlay work in some precious stones, marble bas-reliefs and the lace-like marble screens around the tombs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mushir Ahmad, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India
results.description: A study of the Taj Mahal in Agra. results.title: Synthesis = Synthese. No. 6/77 [English language]
results.brief_description:
French cinemagazine items: Agronomy - general ecology, applied on site to vegetation, provides agronomists with valuable information on the natural environment with a view to its eventual development. To meet the needs of the consumer, agriculture has to increase plant production on a vast scale while maintaining conformity with the parent-plant and this is the subject of laboratory research; as is the improvement of species through genetic selection and hybridisation. Agronomical research in the fight against pests that damage crops, has turned to biological methods that are both specific and innocuous, as for example, in controlling caterpillars.
Suitable for senior students.

results.title: Symphonie mechanique
results.creator_credit: Jean Mitry, Anatole Dauman, P.H. Lifchitz and Argos Films
results.brief_description: In this short experimental piece, Jean Mitry combined shots of industrial machinery with a contemporary score creating a poetic rhythm between image and sound featuring a score by French composer Pierre Boulez entitled ‘Musique Concrete’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Mitry, Anatole Dauman, P.H. Lifchitz and Argos Films

results.title: Surf sail
results.creator_credit: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Cook Strait, which separates the North and South Islands of New Zealand, is one of the most dangerous stretches of water in the world. Three people attempt to cross the Strait, with its unpredictable conditions, tides and currents, on wind surfboards.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
